original: Tevijjasutta
analyzed: tevijjasutta
translated: The one with threefold knowledge

original: Vuttañhetaṁ bhagavatā vuttamarahatāti me sutaṁ:
analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One:

original: “Dhammenāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tevijjaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ paññāpemi, nāññaṁ lapitalāpanamattena.
analyzed: dhammena āha bhikkhave tevijjam brāhmaṇam paññāpemi na aññam lapita lāpana mattena
translated: “Monks, I declare that one with threefold knowledge is a brahmin by birth, not by birth alone, but by virtue of his conduct.

original: Kathañcāhaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammena tevijjaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ paññāpemi, nāññaṁ lapitalāpanamattena?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi🔽jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo vīsampi🔽jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi jātisahassampi
analyzed: katham ca āha bhikkhave dhammena tevijjam brāhmaṇam paññāpemi na aññam lapita lāpana mattena  idha bhikkhave bhikkhu aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati  jātim dve api jātiyaḥ tissaḥ api jātiyaḥ catasso api jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ dasa api jātiyaḥ vīsam pi  jātiyaḥ tisampi jātiyaḥ cattālīsampi jātiyaḥ paññāsampi jātiyaḥ jāti satampi jāti sahassampi
translated: And how is it that I declare that one with threefold knowledge is a brahmin by birth, not by birth alone, but by virtue of his conduct?🔽Here, a monk recollects his manifold past abodes, that is, one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births, a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births, many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and world-evolution: ‘There I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life.

original: jātisatasahassampi anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe:
analyzed: jāti sata sahassam pi aneke api savaṭṭa kappe aneke api vivaṭṭa kappe aneke api savaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe
translated: Passing away from there, I was reborn elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life.🔽Passing away from there, I was reborn here.’ Thus he recollects his manifold past abodes with their aspects and details.

original: ‘amutrāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto.
analyzed: amutra asim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyantaḥ
translated: ‘There I was with such name, such family, such birth, such food, such experience of pleasure and pain, such a life-term.

original: So tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ. Tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī
analyzed: saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgottaḥ eva vaṇṇo evam āhāraḥ eva sukha dukkha ppaṭisavedī
translated: Passing away from there, I re-arose elsewhere; and there too I was with such name, such family, such birth, such food, such experience of pleasure and pain, such a life-term.

original: evamāyupariyanto. So tato cuto idhūpapanno’ti. Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ🔽pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
analyzed: evam āyu pariyantaḥ saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihita  pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: Passing away from there, I re-arose here.’ Thus with their aspects and particulars he recollects his manifold past lives.

original: Ayamassa paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā hoti, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: ayam assa paṭhamā vijjā adhigatā hoti avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: This is his first knowledge, vision, and understanding. Ignorance is abandoned and knowledge has arisen; darkness is abandoned and light has arisen, as happens in one who dwells heedful, ardent, and resolute.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave bhikkhu dibbena cakkunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena
translated: “Again, with his mind thus concentrated, purified, and bright, unblemished, free from defects, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, the bhikkhu directs and inclines it to the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate
analyzed: satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate
translated: He sees beings passing away and re-appearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate.🔽He understands how beings pass on according to their actions (in this way):

original: yathākammūpage satte pajānāti: ‘ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā
analyzed: yathā kammūpage satte pajānāti ime vata bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatā
translated: He understands beings passing away and re-appearing: ‘These worthy beings who are lustful, hateful, and deluded, who revile the noble ones, have wrong view and act wrongly in regard to body, speech, and mind,

original: vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā🔽micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā. Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ
analyzed: vacī duccaritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ duccaritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam upavādakāḥ micchādiṭṭhikā  micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipāta
translated: because of the kammas that are rooted in lust, hate, and delusion, and that are accompanied by wrong view,🔽at the break-up of the body, after death, have re-appeared in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell.

original: nirayaṁ upapannā. Ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena
analyzed: nirayam upapannāḥ ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena
translated: But these other worthy beings who are without lust, hate, and delusion, who do not revile the noble ones, who have right view and act rightly in regard to body, speech, and mind,

original: samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā.🔽Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā’ti. Iti dibbena cakkhunā
analyzed: samannāgatā manaḥ su caritena samannāgatā ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā  te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ti iti dibbena cakkhunā
translated: because of the kammas that are rooted in non-lust, non-hate, and non-delusion, and that are accompanied by right view,

original: visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe
analyzed: visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe
translated: at the break-up of the body, after death, have re-appeared in a good destination, a heavenly world.’ Thus with his mind, thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs and inclines it to knowledge and vision.

original: dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
analyzed: dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti
translated: He understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’🔽He understands: ‘These are the taints’ … ‘This is the origin of the taints’ … ‘This is the cessation of the taints’ … ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: Ayamassa dutiyā vijjā adhigatā hoti, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: ayam assa dutiyā vijjā adhigatā hoti avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: This is the second knowledge he has attained. Ignorance has been destroyed; knowledge has arisen; darkness has been destroyed; light has arisen, as happens for a diligent, ardent, and resolute person living independently.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave bhikkhu āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: “Again, a bhikkhu, by the destruction of the taints, enters and dwells in the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, realizing it for himself with direct knowledge.

original: Ayamassa tatiyā vijjā adhigatā hoti, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā, tamo vihato, āloko uppanno, yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
analyzed: ayam assa tatiyā vijjā adhigatā hoti avijjā vihatā vijjā uppannā tamaḥ vihataḥ ālokaḥ uppannaḥ yathā tam appamattassa ātāpinaḥ pahitattassa viharato
translated: This is the third knowledge he has attained. Ignorance has been destroyed; knowledge has arisen; darkness has been destroyed; light has arisen, as happens for a diligent, ardent, and resolute person living independently.

original: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammena tevijjaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ paññāpemi, nāññaṁ lapitalāpanamattenā”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: evam kho aha bhikkhave dhammena tevijjam brāhmaṇam paññāpemi na aññam lapita lāpana mattena ati  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: “It is in such a way, bhikkhus, that I describe a person as accomplished in wisdom, not as one accomplished in mere talk.🔽The Blessed One said this.

original: Tatthetaṁ iti vuccati:
analyzed: tattha itam iti vuccati
translated: And in connection with this, it was said:

original: “Pubbenivāsaṁ yoveti,
analyzed: pubbenivāsam yaḥ vā iti
translated: “One who remembers past abodes,🔽who sees heaven and the plane of misery,

original: saggāpāyañca passati;🔽Atho jātikkhayaṁ patto,
analyzed: sagga apāyañca passati  atho jāti khayam patto
translated: and who has attained the destruction of birth,

original: abhiññāvosito muni.
analyzed: abhiññā vositaḥ muni
translated: the sage accomplished in direct knowledge,

original: Etāhi tīhi vijjāhi,
analyzed: etāhi tīhi vijjāhi
translated: By these three kinds of knowledge

original: tevijjo hoti brāhmaṇo;
analyzed: tevijjaḥ hoti brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: is a triple-knowledge brahmin.

original: Tamahaṁ vadāmi tevijjaṁ,
analyzed: tam aham vadāmi tevijja
translated: I call him a triple-knowledge brahmin,

original: nāññaṁ lapitalāpanan”ti.
analyzed: na aññam lapita lāpananti
translated: not one who just prattles on.”🔽This is the meaning of what was said by the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun.

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: So it was heard by me.

original: Dasamaṁ.🔽Pañcamo vaggo.
analyzed: dasama  pañcamaḥ vaggo
translated: The tenth.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The fifth sub-chapter is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Pasāda jīvita saṅghāṭi,
analyzed: pasāda jīvita saṅghāṭi
translated: Confidence, life, the outer robe,

original: aggi upaparikkhayā;
analyzed: aggi upaparikkhayā
translated: fire, and investigation,

original: Upapatti kāma kalyāṇaṁ,
analyzed: upapatti kāma kalyāṇa
translated: Rebirth, sensual pleasure, good,

original: dānaṁ dhammena te dasāti.🔽Tikanipāto niṭṭhito.
analyzed: dānam dhammena te dasāti 🔽tika nipātaḥ niṭṭhito
